title: The Communication Model
content: Communication involves sender, message, channel, receiver, and feedback. Failure can occur at any point: unclear encoding, channel noise, poor decoding, or missing feedback. Effective communicators don't assume the message sent is the message received—they verify through feedback.

mcq.question: You radio an instruction to a colleague. There's no response. What should you assume?

options.B: Communication may have failed at any point—verify
options.D: They're busy and will respond later

mcq.explanation: No response means potential failure anywhere: they didn't hear, didn't understand, can't respond, or channel failed. Never assume successful communication without verification.
